Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
Explaination: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.

Explanation:The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/2015-photo-falsely-shared-as-amit-shah-visiting-covid-19-patients-7380

Claim: Audio of Biden calling the coronavirus a hoax.
Explaination: The video was manipulated and is not real.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Audio of Biden calling the coronavirus a hoax.

Explanation:The video was manipulated and is not real.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-audio-of-biden-calling-coronavirus-a-hoax-was-manipulated.html

Claim: Tea can cure coronavirus.
Explaination: Doctors and experts say that there is no scientific evidence to prove that tea can be used to cure coronavirus.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Tea can cure coronavirus.

Explanation:Doctors and experts say that there is no scientific evidence to prove that tea can be used to cure coronavirus.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/doctors-say-no-data-to-claim-tea-can-cure-coronavirus-that-is-a-fake-message

Claim: Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away, did not comply with the authorities and tested positive.
Explaination: The Indian daily misreported as the woman had not yet tested positive and she did not flee so as to not be tested.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away, did not comply with the authorities and tested positive.

Explanation:The Indian daily misreported as the woman had not yet tested positive and she did not flee so as to not be tested.

https://www.boomlive.in/coronavirustopstories/times-of-india-misreports-agra-woman-fleeing-after-coronavirus-tests-7229

Claim: President Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the U.S. is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.”
Explaination: There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the U.S. is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.”

Explanation:There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/17/chain-message/fact-checking-chain-message-about-national-quarant/

Claim: NY Governor Andrew Cuomo did not reject buying 16,000 ventilators in 2015.
Explaination: The report referred to did not actually make any recommendations for buying ventilators.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY Governor Andrew Cuomo did not reject buying 16,000 ventilators in 2015.

Explanation:The report referred to did not actually make any recommendations for buying ventilators.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-ny-gov-cuomo-did-NOT-reject-buying-recommended-16000-ventilators-in-2015-for-pandemic.html

Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.
Explaination: Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.

Explanation:Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/10/the-ministry-of-tourism-has-not-issued-any-order-closing-down-restaurants-till-october/

Claim: Trump web ad usings misleading edits to create a false picture.
Explaination: These are actual quotes but in the video they are so truncated and mixed together that overall it leaves a misleading impression.
Label: Two Pinocchios
html:
Claim: Trump web ad usings misleading edits to create a false picture.

Explanation:These are actual quotes but in the video they are so truncated and mixed together that overall it leaves a misleading impression.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/03/31/new-trump-video-offers-more-spin-than-hope/

Claim: A photo of a couple locked in an intimate embrace with their face masks lowered has been shared in Facebook posts that claim they were nurses who were treating COVID-19 patients in an Italian hospital.
Explaination: This is false, the photo was taken by an Associated Press photographer at Barcelona’s airport.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a couple locked in an intimate embrace with their face masks lowered has been shared in Facebook posts that claim they were nurses who were treating COVID-19 patients in an Italian hospital.

Explanation:This is false, the photo was taken by an Associated Press photographer at Barcelona’s airport.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-does-not-show-nurses-treating-covid-19-patients-italy

Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-15.html

Claim: Garlic water prevents the novel coronavirus, according to a Chinese doctor.
Explaination: The WHO has not prescribed any methods, there is no link with the recent coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Garlic water prevents the novel coronavirus, according to a Chinese doctor.

Explanation:The WHO has not prescribed any methods, there is no link with the recent coronavirus.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/boiled-garlic-water-for-treating-coronavirus-not-really-6737

Claim: A misleading chart being spread on Facebook, erroneously dubbing the new coronavirus the “least deadly virus.”
Explaination: The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A misleading chart being spread on Facebook, erroneously dubbing the new coronavirus the “least deadly virus.”

Explanation:The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/infographic-on-facebook-distorts-comparative-facts-on-viruses/

Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.
Explaination: Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.

Explanation:Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-countries-with-high-rates-of-childhood-vaccinations-are-not-hardest-hit-with-coronavirus.html

Claim: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers is “pushing firearm confiscation orders.”
Explaination: A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers had not proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers is “pushing firearm confiscation orders.”

Explanation:A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers had not proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/25/facebook-posts/old-claim-tony-evers-and-gun-confiscation-wrong/

Claim: The government is closing businesses to stop the spread of coronavirus even though “the numbers are nothing compared to H1N1 or Ebola. Everyone needs to realize our government is up to something …”
Explaination: Any suggestion that the coronavirus isn't real or that it’s part of a government conspiracy is a ridiculous claim.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: The government is closing businesses to stop the spread of coronavirus even though “the numbers are nothing compared to H1N1 or Ebola. Everyone needs to realize our government is up to something …”

Explanation:Any suggestion that the coronavirus isn't real or that it’s part of a government conspiracy is a ridiculous claim.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/06/facebook-posts/fact-checking-viral-pa-facebook-post-coronavirus-s/

Claim: “Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The coronavirus.”
Explaination: A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The coronavirus.”

Explanation:A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/23/facebook-posts/100-covid-19-cure-no-chloroquine-effectiveness-onl/

Claim: “Breaking: UK prepares for full lockdown after hundreds of new cases — Wuhan super virus updates.”
Explaination: Only about a dozen coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the United Kingdom.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Breaking: UK prepares for full lockdown after hundreds of new cases — Wuhan super virus updates.”

Explanation:Only about a dozen coronavirus cases have been confirmed in the United Kingdom.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/25/facebook-posts/no-evidence-united-kingdom-preparing-lockdown-over/

Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
Explaination: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Last picture of Indonesian Dr. Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.

Explanation:This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby
Explaination: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby

Explanation:The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

https://myanmar.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-post-with-a-photo-claiming-that-an-italian-mother-suffering-covid-19-infection-hugs-her-baby/

Claim: Did Donald Trump attempt to steal a COVID-19 vaccine from a German company and refuse testing kits from WHO?
Explaination: Reports that Trump tried to pay a German company for the rights to a vaccine are not confirmed, and the U.S. government did not refuse tests from the World Health Organization.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Did Donald Trump attempt to steal a COVID-19 vaccine from a German company and refuse testing kits from WHO?

Explanation:Reports that Trump tried to pay a German company for the rights to a vaccine are not confirmed, and the U.S. government did not refuse tests from the World Health Organization.

https://youtu.be/vdXL5-6TdqA

Claim: Walmart has adopted staggered shopping days based on age in response to the pandemic.
Explaination: Walmart has not restricted shopping days by age, except for weekly hour for senior citizens.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Walmart has adopted staggered shopping days based on age in response to the pandemic.

Explanation:Walmart has not restricted shopping days by age, except for weekly hour for senior citizens.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/04/walmart-hasnt-adopted-staggered-shopping-based-on-age/

Claim: Uber suspends night services in Kenya.
Explaination: Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Uber suspends night services in Kenya.

Explanation:Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.

https://pesacheck.org/false-uber-has-not-suspended-night-services-in-kenya-9ddbe374b30?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Channel 4’s Jon Snow is infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: Jon Snow was on a self-isolation after an Iran assignment in late February and has reported to work after 14 day period, and continues to be part of the Channel4 News and to-date has not contracted COVID-19, verified from his Twitter account and verified News sources.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Channel 4’s Jon Snow is infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:Jon Snow was on a self-isolation after an Iran assignment in late February and has reported to work after 14 day period, and continues to be part of the Channel4 News and to-date has not contracted COVID-19, verified from his Twitter account and verified News sources.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/fact-check-jon-snow-had-not-contracted-covid-19-after-the-late-february-assignment-in-iran/

Claim: Drinking “water a lot and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates” the coronavirus.
Explaination: Neither drinking a lot of water, nor gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, has been identified as working against the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Drinking “water a lot and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates” the coronavirus.

Explanation:Neither drinking a lot of water, nor gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, has been identified as working against the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/viral-image/gargling-salt-water-can-ease-sore-throat-it-wont-k/

Claim: An image of a doctor goes viral with the claim that Dr. Usman Riyaz died while treating coronavirus patients in Delhi, India.
Explaination: he photo that has been gone viral is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from Dubai. He is alive and healthy. He does not work in Delhi. He has put out a Facebook post rubbishing the rumors of his death. We also found that one Dr. Osman Riyaz has died in Pakistan due to COVID-19. We also confirmed with Delhi Health Department that no doctor has been died due to coronavirus in Delhi.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image of a doctor goes viral with the claim that Dr. Usman Riyaz died while treating coronavirus patients in Delhi, India.

Explanation:he photo that has been gone viral is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from Dubai. He is alive and healthy. He does not work in Delhi. He has put out a Facebook post rubbishing the rumors of his death. We also found that one Dr. Osman Riyaz has died in Pakistan due to COVID-19. We also confirmed with Delhi Health Department that no doctor has been died due to coronavirus in Delhi.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/fake-post-goes-viral-as-dr-riaz-form-delhi-died-while-treating-corona-patients/
